#Text=Putin calls US troops in Poland ' a threat '
#Text=Friday , January 13 , 2017
#Text=Reports yesterday indicated Russian President Vladimir Putin views the arrival of US troops in Poland as " a threat " .
#Text=US troops and tanks in Poland in 2015 , as part of an earlier deployment under Operation Atlantic Resolve .
#Text=Image : Sgt. Christina Dion ( US Army ) .
#Text=Earlier this week around a quarter of 4,000 troops earmarked for Poland crossed into Poland from Germany .
#Text=Also included were trucks , tanks , and Humvee s.
#Text=Many are set to be based in Żagań , where Polish Prime Minister Beata Szydło and Defence Minister Antoni Macierewicz are scheduled to ceremonially welcome them tomorrow .
#Text=Part of Operation Atlantic Resolve , the deployment is set to include Abrams tanks , Bradley Fighting Vehicle s , and Paladin artillery .
#Text=It is the largest deployment of US troops to Europe since the Cold War ended .
#Text=The presence of US assets " threatens our interests and our security , " according to Putin .

column1: #Text=" It 's a third country that is building up its military presence on our borders in Europe , " he told the BBC .
#Text=" It is n't even a European country . "
#Text=Outgoing US President Barack Obama authorised the move in response to Russian intervention in Ukraine in 2014 , in which Crimea was annexed .
#Text=It was agreed at a NATO summit in Warsaw last year .
#Text=Tomasz Szatkowski , Polish Undersecretary of State for Defence , noted " large exercises " by Russia near the Polish border as another reason the troops were needed .
#Text=Szatkowski also mentioned Russian action in Ukraine , which he called " aggressive actions in our vicinity " .
#Text=Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Alexei Mechkov , however , said the incoming troops and vehicles were a " factor destabilising European security " .

column1: #Text=In recent months tension has mounted further as Russia deployed missiles to Kalingrad .
#Text=The enclave , Russian territory lying between Poland and Lithuania , now has nuclear -capable Iskanders and anti-ship Bastion equipment .
#Text=NATO considered these deployments a response to its own .
#Text=The US troops are set to rotate around the Balkans every nine months .
#Text=Other planned host nations are Estonia , Latvia , Lithuania , Romania , Bulgaria , and Hungary .
#Text=The rotation is due to a treaty with Russia preventing permanent deployment to any particular territory .
#Text=Russia-US relations face a potential thaw , as President-Elect Donald Trump moves towards office on January 20 .
#Text=Trump has made clear he intends to seek a closer relationship with Russia .
#Text=Rex Tillerson , proposed Secretary of State for the Trump administration , implied the troops would be staying put .
#Text=He said Russia had claimed Crimea " as an act of force " requiring the US to offer " a proportional show of force " .
#Text=Trump 's proposed Secretary of Defense , James Mattis , backed NATO before the US Senate yesterday .
#Text=He said Putin aimed to weaken the NATO alliance .
#Text=Witold Waszczykowski , Polish foreign minister , earlier this week remarked any improvement in US-Russia relations should avoid harming Polish interests .
